## Deepener - The Sleep Cloud

"Imagine yourself lying on a soft, billowing cloud. The cloud cradles you gently, supporting every part of your body. (Pause 3s) Above you, the sky is a deep, starlit expanse.

Stars twinkle softly. The air is cool and still. (Pause 3s) You feel yourself drifting... floating... as the cloud moves slowly through the night sky.

There is no rush. No obligation. Only peace. (Pause 5s)

With each breath, you sink a little deeper into the cloud. Your body becomes heavier... softer... more relaxed. (Pause 5s) The stars seem to pulse gently, in rhythm with your slowing heartbeat.

Your mind grows quiet. Your thoughts drift away like wisps. (Pause 3s) You are safe here.

You are supported. You are drifting naturally toward sleep. (Pause 5s) Let this feeling of floating on the sleep cloud draw you deeper.

Your eyes are already closed. Your body knows how to rest. You are surrendering to the natural pull of sleep. (Pause 5s)"

## Therapeutic Content

"Now, in this peaceful space, recognise that your body has a natural ability to sleep. (Pause 3s) Sleep is not something you must force or fight for. It is a capacity you already possess.

Your nervous system knows how to quieten. Your mind knows how to rest. (Pause 5s) Any old patterns of racing thoughts, tension at bedtime, or fear of not sleeping simply soften and fade.

In their place, a calm certainty grows: you can sleep. You will sleep. (Pause 5s) Imagine your bedroom as a sanctuary.

A place reserved for rest. Soft, comfortable, and inviting. (Pause 3s) When you lie down at night, your body recognises this as the signal to unwind.

Your breath slows. Your muscles release. (Pause 5s) You deserve peaceful bedtimes.

No screens, no urgency, no mental lists taking over. Just a gentle wind-down. A ritual that tells your mind and body: it is time to rest. (Pause 5s)

From this moment forward, you will find it easier to fall asleep. You will allow yourself to drift. You will trust that sleep will come. (Pause 3s)

When you climb into bed, you can picture the sleep cloud. You can feel yourself floating. You can let go. (Pause 5s)

Deep, restorative sleep is available to you. Your body uses this time to repair, to restore, to consolidate. You wake refreshed because you have allowed yourself to rest fully. (Pause 5s)

Any belief that you are a bad sleeper, or that sleep is elusive, simply dissolves. You are reclaiming your natural ability to sleep well. (Pause 3s) See yourself tonight... getting into bed with a sense of calm.

You close your eyes. You breathe. You feel the soft cloud beneath you.

You drift. (Pause 5s) See yourself waking in the morning... feeling refreshed. Your mind is clear.

Your body has had the rest it needed. (Pause 5s) See yourself in the weeks to come... bedtime becoming something you look forward to. A gift you give yourself.

Not a battle. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious has received these suggestions. It will support your sleep.

It will remind you of the sleep cloud when your mind starts to race. (Pause 5s) If you wake in the night, you can return to the image of the cloud. You can breathe.

You can drift back to sleep without struggle. (Pause 5s) You deserve deep, restorative sleep. You deserve to wake refreshed and ready for your day. (Pause 3s)

The sleep cloud is within you. Whenever you need to rest, you can close your eyes and feel yourself floating. (Pause 5s) Your body was designed to sleep.

You are not broken. You are rediscovering what has always been there. (Pause 3s) From this day forward, bedtime is a peaceful transition.

You let go of the day. You surrender to the night. You sleep deeply. (Pause 5s)

When you listen to this before bed, you may drift off during or after. That is perfect. If you fall asleep, you stay asleep.

If you complete the script, you carry the calm with you into the night. (Pause 5s) You recognise that rest is not laziness. It is necessity.

You honour your need for sleep. (Pause 3s) The starlit sky and the soft cloud are yours. They represent safety, stillness, and the natural pull of sleep. (Pause 5s)

Your subconscious will remind you: you can sleep. You have always had this ability. You are allowing it to return. (Pause 3s)

So let this feeling sink in. You are calm. You are ready for rest.

You trust your body to sleep. (Pause 5s) In the days to come, you will notice yourself feeling more rested. More patient.

More able to face the day. (Pause 5s) Sleep nourishes you. It is not a luxury.

It is the foundation of your wellbeing. (Pause 3s) Whenever anxiety or thoughts try to keep you awake, you can return to the cloud. To the stars.

To the knowledge that you are safe and that sleep will come. (Pause 5s) You are becoming someone who sleeps well. Who respects the need for rest.

Who wakes refreshed. (Pause 3s) The sleep cloud is yours. Use it every night.

Let it carry you into deep, restorative sleep. (Pause 5s) You deserve to wake feeling wonderful. You deserve nights of peaceful, uninterrupted rest. (Pause 3s)

Your mind and body will remember this experience. When you lie down, they will respond. They will relax.

They will sleep. (Pause 5s) Consider the rhythm of your evenings. A consistent wind-down tells your brain that sleep is coming.

Dim the lights. Put aside work and screens. Perhaps you read, or listen to gentle music, or simply breathe. (Pause 3s)

Your bedroom becomes associated only with rest and intimacy. Not with worry, not with screens, not with the day's unfinished business. (Pause 5s) That association strengthens every night you use the sleep cloud.

Your subconscious learns: this room, this bed, this position means sleep. (Pause 5s) Even if you have had years of poor sleep, the brain can relearn. Neuroplasticity means that new patterns can replace old ones.

You are giving your mind and body a new pattern tonight. (Pause 3s) When you wake in the small hours, you need not spiral into frustration. You can simply breathe.

You can picture the cloud. You can say to yourself: I am safe. I can drift again. (Pause 5s)

Many people fall back to sleep when they stop fighting. When they stop checking the clock. When they return to the image of the starlit sky and the soft support beneath them. (Pause 5s)

You are not broken. You are not defective. You are human, and you are giving yourself permission to rest. (Pause 3s)

The more you practise this script, the stronger the association becomes. The sleep cloud becomes an instant trigger for relaxation. (Pause 5s) Waking refreshed is not luck.

It is the natural result of deep, restorative sleep. Your body repairs itself at night. Your mind consolidates memories and processes the day. (Pause 3s)

When you allow yourself to sleep well, you are investing in every area of your life: your mood, your concentration, your patience, your health. (Pause 5s) Some nights will still be easier than others. That is normal.

What matters is that you have a resourcethe sleep cloudand a belief in your ability to sleep. (Pause 5s) You no longer need to dread bedtime. You can look forward to the soft cloud, the starlit sky, and the gentle drift into rest. (Pause 3s)

Your natural ability to sleep is your birthright. Civilisation has brought screens and schedules, but your nervous system still knows how to switch off when you give it the right cues. (Pause 5s) Peaceful bedtime, a dark room, a cool temperature, and the image of the sleep cloud are those cues. (Pause 5s)

Every night you drift off with the sleep cloud, you reinforce the message: I can sleep. I do sleep. I wake refreshed. (Pause 3s)

Deep restorative sleep and waking refreshed are within your reach. Your natural ability to sleep is real. Trust it. (Pause 5s)

So hold on to this feeling as we prepare to bring you back. You have connected with the sleep cloud. You have connected with your natural ability to sleep. (Pause 5s)

If this recording is used at bedtime, you may choose to remain in this state and drift into sleep. If so, let yourself go. Sleep deeply.

Wake refreshed. (Pause 3s) If you are listening at another time, you will carry this calm with you. When bedtime comes, you will remember the cloud.

You will drift. (Pause 5s) You have everything you need to sleep well. A calm mind.

A relaxed body. The image of the sleep cloud. (Pause 3s) From this day forward, you honour your sleep.

You create a peaceful bedtime. You allow yourself to rest deeply and wake refreshed. (Pause 5s) The starlit sky is within you.

The soft cloud is within you. Sleep is your birthright. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious has received these suggestions.

It will support restful nights and refreshed mornings. (Pause 5s) You are not fighting sleep anymore. You are welcoming it.

You are floating into it. (Pause 3s) So take this gift with you. The gift of peaceful sleep.

The gift of the sleep cloud. (Pause 5s) You deserve to wake refreshed. You deserve nights of deep, restorative rest.

The sleep cloud is yours. Use it. Trust it.

You can sleep. You will sleep. You will wake refreshed. (Pause 3s)

Whenever you listen again, the connection deepens. Your ability to drift into sleep strengthens. (Pause 5s) You are allowing a part of yourself that has always known how to rest to take the lead. (Pause 3s)

The cloud is yours. The stars are yours. The feeling of drifting into sleep is yours. (Pause 5s)

So as you go back into your day, or as you drift into sleep, carry the sleep cloud with you. You have this resource now. (Pause 3s) You have the natural ability to sleep.

You have the image of the cloud. You have the choice to create a peaceful bedtime and to allow deep, restorative sleep. (Pause 5s) You are a good sleeper.

You wake refreshed. You deserve rest. Believe it.

Live it. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious will remind you. Whenever the night comes, you can return to the cloud.

To the stars. To the peace of drifting into sleep. (Pause 5s) You have taken an important step.

You have connected with your ability to sleep. Let it guide you. Let it restore you. (Pause 3s)

So go forward with this calm. With this trust. With the knowledge that you can sleep deeply and wake refreshed. (Pause 5s)

The sleep cloud is always with you. You are ready. You can sleep.

Believe it. (Pause 3s) You have the sleep cloud. You have the ability to rest.

Use them well. You are at ease. Sleep will come. (Pause 3s)

Your subconscious holds the image of the sleep cloud. It will remind you to breathe and drift. You can sleep.

Trust yourself. You have this now. The cloud is yours.

Restful sleep is your choice. From this day forward. You are ready.

You will sleep well. Go in peace."

## Termination

"Now, it is time to gently return to your full waking awareness, bringing with you all the positive feelings of calm, restfulness, and your natural ability to sleep. (Pause 3s) I will count from one to five, and with each number, you will feel more and more alert, refreshed, and readyor, if you are listening at bedtime, you may allow yourself to drift into sleep and remain asleep. If you are waking now:

One... beginning to feel a gentle energy returning to your body. You are safe and grounded. Two... becoming more aware of your surroundings, feeling grounded and present in the room.

Three... feeling refreshed and invigorated, carrying your newfound sense of peace and readiness for restful sleep with you. Four... your mind is clear, your body is energised, and you are ready to open your eyes. And five... eyes open, wide awake, feeling absolutely wonderful, calm, and readyor, if it is bedtime, eyes may stay closed as you drift into deep, restorative sleep and wake refreshed in the morning. (Pause 3s)

Remember: the sleep cloud is within you. You have a natural ability to sleep. You can rest deeply and wake refreshed."

scripts.title: Overcoming Fear of Flying
scripts.introduction: This script is designed to help individuals overcome their fear of flying, promoting a sense of calm, confidence, and ease during air travel. It aims to reprogram anxious associations with flying into feelings of safety and comfort.
scripts.content:
## Induction - Progressive Relaxation

"As you settle into a comfortable position, allow your eyes to gently close. (Pause 3s) Take a deep, calming breath in through your nose... and as you exhale slowly through your mouth, release any tension you might be holding in your shoulders or your jaw. (Pause 3s) Continue to breathe deeply and evenly, allowing each breath to carry you deeper into relaxation.

With every out-breath, you let go a little more. With every in-breath, you invite calm and stillness. (Pause 5s)

Bring your awareness to your feet. Notice the weight of your feet resting on the floor or the surface beneath you. Feel your toes relaxing... each toe letting go of any tension.

Feel the soles of your feet becoming soft and heavy. Feel your heels sinking... your ankles releasing. (Pause 3s) Let this wave of relaxation move slowly up through your calves, your shins, and your knees.

Your legs feel heavy and relaxed, as if they are gently melting into the support beneath you. (Pause 5s)

Feel your thighs relaxing, becoming soft and loose. This soothing sensation continues into your hips and your lower back, releasing any stiffness or holding. Your abdomen softens... your stomach muscles letting go completely.

Your chest relaxes with each gentle breath. (Pause 3s) Feel the relaxation spreading up your spine, vertebra by vertebra... through your shoulders, and down your arms to your elbows, your forearms, your wrists, and your fingertips. Your arms are loose and heavy. (Pause 5s)

Your neck relaxes... your jaw unclenches... your tongue rests gently in your mouth... your facial muscles soften... your forehead is smooth and calm. Your eyelids feel wonderfully heavy. (Pause 3s) You are now deeply relaxed, peaceful, and calm.

Your whole body feels supported. Your mind is becoming still. (Pause 5s) Every time you breathe out, you go a little deeper.

Deeper and deeper into this safe, comfortable state of relaxation. Nothing can disturb you here. You are safe.

You are at ease. (Pause 5s)"

## Deepener - The Cloud Journey

"Imagine yourself floating on a soft, white cloud in a vast blue sky. The sky is clear and endless. The sun is warm and gentle. (Pause 3s)

You are safe on this cloud. It holds you securely. There is no falling.

Only floating. (Pause 3s) The cloud moves slowly, smoothly, through the calm blue expanse. You feel serene.

You feel safe. (Pause 5s) Below you, the world looks peaceful. You are above any worry.

Above any fear. (Pause 5s) The air is still. The journey is smooth.

Your body is relaxed. Your mind is at peace. (Pause 3s) This is what flying can feel like.

Safe. Serene. A gentle journey through the sky. (Pause 5s)

Let this feeling of safety and calm draw you deeper. You are on the cloud. You are secure.

You are at ease. (Pause 5s)"

## Therapeutic Content

"Now, in this peaceful space, recognise that flying is one of the safest ways to travel. (Pause 3s) Millions of people fly every day. Pilots are highly trained.

Aircraft are designed for safety. You are in capable hands. (Pause 5s) Any old patterns of fear, dread at the airport, or anxiety about take-off simply soften and fade.

In their place, a calm confidence grows: you can fly. You can feel calm. (Pause 5s) Imagine yourself at the airport.

You have arrived in good time. You move through security with ease. (Pause 3s) The airport is not a place of threat.

It is a place of transition. A gateway to somewhere new. You feel organised.

You feel prepared. (Pause 5s) You board the plane. You find your seat.

You breathe. You recognise that this is a normal, safe activity. (Pause 5s) From this moment forward, you will find it easier to stay calm at the airport and on the plane.

You will focus on your breath. You will focus on the fact that you are safe. (Pause 3s) The smooth ascent into the sky can feel like the cloud journey.

You are rising gently. The pilots know what they are doing. (Pause 5s) If there is turbulence, you recognise it as normal.

Like driving over a bump in the road. The plane is built for it. It does not mean danger. (Pause 5s)

You can keep breathing. You can keep your body relaxed. Turbulence is minor.

It passes. You remain safe. (Pause 3s) See yourself at the airport... calm, organised, and focused.

You are not fighting the experience. You are moving through it. (Pause 5s) See yourself on the plane... seated, breathing steadily.

The take-off is smooth. You feel the cloud beneath you. You feel safe. (Pause 5s)

See yourself arriving at your destination... refreshed, proud of yourself. You did it. You flew.

You managed your fear. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious has received these suggestions. It will remind you that flying is safe.

It will remind you of the cloud journey when anxiety rises. (Pause 5s) You deserve to travel by air without overwhelming fear. You deserve to feel calm and in control. (Pause 5s)

The cloud journey is within you. Whenever you need to feel safe in the sky, you can close your eyes and see the blue sky, the soft cloud, the serenity. (Pause 3s) You are not denying that flying can feel strange.

You are choosing to respond with calm rather than panic. (Pause 5s) From this day forward, you will approach flying with a new mindset. You will prepare.

You will breathe. You will remind yourself: I am safe. This is normal. (Pause 5s)

When you feel the first flicker of fear at the airport or on the plane, you can return to the cloud. To the blue sky. To the feeling of floating safely. (Pause 3s)

You recognise that your body may still send signals of anxiety. You can acknowledge them without being ruled by them. You can breathe through them. (Pause 5s)

Arriving at your destination refreshed and proud is your right. You are capable of this. (Pause 5s) Your subconscious will support you.

It will remind you that you have practised this calm. That you have the cloud journey. (Pause 3s) So let this feeling sink in.

Flying can be safe. You can be calm. You can arrive refreshed and proud. (Pause 5s)

In the days before a flight, you will notice yourself feeling more prepared. You will have strategies: breathing, imagery, the memory of this relaxation. (Pause 5s) On the day of the flight, you will use them.

You will stay grounded. You will stay calm. (Pause 3s) When the plane takes off, you can picture the cloud.

When there is turbulence, you can breathe and remember: this is normal. I am safe. (Pause 5s) You are becoming someone who can fly with greater ease.

Who can travel by air without being overwhelmed by fear. (Pause 3s) The cloud journey is yours. Use it every time you fly.

Let it carry you through the experience. (Pause 5s) You deserve to see the world. You deserve to visit people you love.

You deserve to fly without terror. (Pause 3s) Your mind and body will remember this experience. When you board a plane, they will have a new reference: safety, calm, the blue sky. (Pause 5s)

Remember that the crew and pilots fly every day. For them, this is routine. They are trained for every scenario.

The aircraft you board is maintained to the highest standards. (Pause 3s) Statistics can feel cold when you are anxious, but your subconscious can hold a simpler truth: millions of flights land safely every day. Yours can be one of them. (Pause 5s)

At the airport, give yourself time. Rushing amplifies anxiety. Arrive early.

Move slowly. Breathe. (Pause 5s) On the plane, use your breath.

In for four counts. Hold for four. Out for four.

This calms the nervous system and gives your mind something to focus on. (Pause 3s) If you are travelling with someone, you can tell them you are working on staying calm. Their presence can be part of your sense of safety. (Pause 5s)

If you travel alone, you still have the cloud journey. You have this recording. You have your breath.

You have the image of the blue sky and the soft, steady cloud. (Pause 5s) After you land, take a moment to acknowledge yourself. You did it.

You faced your fear. You arrived refreshed and proud because you chose calm. (Pause 3s) Listen to this script in the days before your flight.

The more you rehearse the cloud journey in a relaxed state, the more your subconscious will associate flying with calm. (Pause 5s) On the day of the flight, you might listen again in the morning or at the airport. You are building a bridge between the safe, relaxed state and the actual experience. (Pause 5s)

The blue sky and the soft cloud are not childish. They are a powerful anchor. Your mind responds to imagery.

It responds to safety. (Pause 3s) You are not erasing your fear overnight. You are building a new response: calm at the airport, calm on the plane, smooth ascent, turbulence as minor, arriving refreshed and proud. (Pause 5s)

Each flight you take with greater calm is proof that you can do this. Your subconscious stores those successes. (Pause 3s) Flying as safe, calm at the airport and on the plane, smooth ascent, turbulence as minor, arriving refreshed and proud: these are the suggestions your mind will carry. (Pause 5s)

You have chosen to work on this fear. That in itself is courageous. Your subconscious will now support you to feel calm and in control when you fly. (Pause 3s)

At the airport you will feel calmer. On the plane you will breathe and remember the cloud journey. The smooth ascent will feel manageable.

Any turbulence will feel minor. And when you land, you will feel refreshed and proud of yourself. (Pause 5s) Flying is safe.

You can be calm at the airport and on the plane. The ascent can be smooth. Turbulence is minor.

You will arrive refreshed and proud. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious has absorbed these suggestions. When you next fly, you will have the cloud journey to return to.

You will feel calmer and more in control. You deserve to travel by air with peace and to arrive refreshed and proud. (Pause 5s) So hold on to this feeling as we prepare to bring you back.

You have connected with the cloud journey. You have connected with calm, safe flying. (Pause 5s) You have everything you need to approach flying with greater peace.

A calm mind. A relaxed body. The image of the cloud in the blue sky. (Pause 3s)

From this day forward, you choose to see flying as safe. You choose to stay calm at the airport and on the plane. You choose to arrive refreshed and proud. (Pause 5s)

The blue sky and the soft cloud are within you. They represent safety, serenity, and the possibility of peaceful travel. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious has received these suggestions.

It will support you on your next flight and every flight after. (Pause 5s) You are not pretending that fear does not exist. You are building a stronger response: calm, breath, and the knowledge that you are safe. (Pause 3s)

So take this gift with you. The gift of the cloud journey. The gift of calm in the sky. (Pause 5s)

You deserve to fly without overwhelming fear. You deserve to arrive refreshed and proud. The cloud journey is yours.

Use it. Trust it. (Pause 3s) Whenever you listen again, especially before a flight, the connection will deepen.

Your sense of safety will grow. (Pause 5s) You are allowing a part of yourself that can be calm and confident to take the lead when you fly. (Pause 3s) The cloud is yours.

The blue sky is yours. The feeling of safe, serene travel is yours. (Pause 5s) So as you go back into your day, carry the cloud journey with you.

When you book a flight, when you pack, when you arrive at the airport, remember: you have this resource. (Pause 3s) You have the ability to stay calm. You have the image of the cloud.

You have the choice to breathe and to focus on safety. (Pause 5s) You can fly. You can feel calm.

You can arrive refreshed and proud. Believe it. Live it. (Pause 3s)

Your subconscious will remind you. Whenever you fly, you can return to the cloud. To the blue sky.

To the peace of the journey. (Pause 5s) You have taken an important step. You have connected with calm, safe flying.

Let it guide you. Let it support your travels. (Pause 3s) So go forward with this calm.

With this confidence. With the knowledge that you can fly with greater ease and arrive refreshed and proud. (Pause 5s) Your mind has received this training.

It will support you. You are ready. You can fly calmly.

Believe it. (Pause 3s) You have the cloud journey. You have the ability to stay calm.

Use them well. You are at ease. Flying can be safe and serene. (Pause 3s)

Your subconscious holds the image of the cloud journey. It will remind you to breathe and to focus on safety. You can fly.

Trust yourself. You have this now. The cloud is yours.

Calm flying is your choice. From this day forward. You are ready.

Go in peace."

## Termination

"Now, it is time to gently return to your full waking awareness, bringing with you all the positive feelings of calm, safety, and confidence about flying. (Pause 3s) I will count from one to five, and with each number, you will feel more and more alert, refreshed, and ready to engage with your day.

One... beginning to feel a gentle energy returning to your body. You are safe and grounded. Two... becoming more aware of your surroundings, feeling grounded and present in the room.

Three... feeling refreshed and invigorated, carrying your newfound calm about flying with you. Four... your mind is clear, your body is energised, and you are ready to open your eyes. And five... eyes open, wide awake, feeling absolutely wonderful, calm, and ready to embrace your dayand your next flightwith serenity and pride. (Pause 3s)

Remember: the cloud journey is within you. Flying can be safe and calm. You can arrive refreshed and proud."

scripts.title: Weight Management
scripts.introduction: This script is designed to help individuals achieve and maintain a healthy weight by fostering mindful eating, increasing motivation for physical activity, and promoting a positive body image. It aims to reprogram subconscious associations with food and exercise for sustainable results.
scripts.content:
## Induction - Progressive Relaxation

"As you settle into a comfortable position, allow your eyes to gently close. (Pause 3s) Take a deep, calming breath in through your nose... and as you exhale slowly through your mouth, release any tension you might be holding in your shoulders or your jaw. (Pause 3s) Continue to breathe deeply and evenly, allowing each breath to carry you deeper into relaxation.

With every out-breath, you let go a little more. With every in-breath, you invite calm and stillness. (Pause 5s)

Bring your awareness to your feet. Notice the weight of your feet resting on the floor or the surface beneath you. Feel your toes relaxing... each toe letting go of any tension.

Feel the soles of your feet becoming soft and heavy. Feel your heels sinking... your ankles releasing. (Pause 3s) Let this wave of relaxation move slowly up through your calves, your shins, and your knees.

Your legs feel heavy and relaxed, as if they are gently melting into the support beneath you. (Pause 5s)

Feel your thighs relaxing, becoming soft and loose. This soothing sensation continues into your hips and your lower back, releasing any stiffness or holding. Your abdomen softens... your stomach muscles letting go completely.

Your chest relaxes with each gentle breath. (Pause 3s) Feel the relaxation spreading up your spine, vertebra by vertebra... through your shoulders, and down your arms to your elbows, your forearms, your wrists, and your fingertips. Your arms are loose and heavy. (Pause 5s)

Your neck relaxes... your jaw unclenches... your tongue rests gently in your mouth... your facial muscles soften... your forehead is smooth and calm. Your eyelids feel wonderfully heavy. (Pause 3s) You are now deeply relaxed, peaceful, and calm.

Your whole body feels supported. Your mind is becoming still. (Pause 5s) Every time you breathe out, you go a little deeper.

Deeper and deeper into this safe, comfortable state of relaxation. Nothing can disturb you here. You are safe.

You are at ease. (Pause 5s)"

## Deepener - The Healthy Body

"Imagine yourself standing in a place of perfect balance. Perhaps a gentle meadow, or a quiet room filled with soft light. (Pause 3s) You feel your body from within.

Strong. Alive. Vital. (Pause 3s)

There is no judgement here. Only a sense of equilibrium. Your body knows what it needs.

It knows how to move. How to rest. How to be nourished. (Pause 5s)

You see yourself moving with easewalking, stretching, breathing. Your muscles are supple. Your energy flows. (Pause 5s)

In your mind's eye, you see a pair of scales in perfect balance. Not restriction on one side and excess on the other. Just balance.

Nourishment. Care. (Pause 3s) This is the healthy body.

Not a number. Not a shape. A feeling of vitality, balance, and respect for yourself. (Pause 5s)

Let this feeling draw you deeper. You are in balance. You are capable of sustainable, healthy habits.

You are worthy of feeling good in your body. (Pause 5s)"

## Therapeutic Content

"Now, in this balanced space, recognise that weight management is not about deprivation. (Pause 3s) It is about nourishment. About feeding your body well, moving in ways that feel good, and treating yourself with kindness. (Pause 5s)

Any old patterns of restrictive dieting, guilt around food, or negative body image simply soften and fade. In their place, a calm, positive approach grows: you can eat mindfully. You can move with joy.

You can respect your body. (Pause 5s) Mindful eating becomes natural. You notice when you are hungry.

You notice when you are full. You eat with attention and without shame. (Pause 3s) Food is not the enemy.

It is fuel and pleasure. You choose foods that nourish you. You enjoy them.

You stop when you are satisfied. (Pause 5s) Movement is not punishment. It is a gift you give your body.

You find ways to move that you enjoywalking, dancing, stretching, swimming. (Pause 5s) From this moment forward, you will find it easier to make choices that support your health. You will eat mindfully.

You will move regularly. You will do both because they feel good, not because you are punishing yourself. (Pause 3s) Your body image shifts.

You begin to see your body as capable. As worthy of care. As something to respect, not to fight. (Pause 5s)

Sustainable habits are the goal. Not quick fixes. Not extremes.

Small, consistent choices that you can maintain for life. (Pause 5s) You recognise that nourishment means more than food. It means rest, connection, and self-compassion. (Pause 3s)

See yourself at mealtimes... pausing before you eat. Noticing the colours, the smells, the flavours. Eating slowly.

Stopping when you are full. (Pause 5s) See yourself moving... not because you have to, but because it feels good. A walk in the fresh air.

A stretch in the morning. (Pause 5s) See yourself in the mirror... with kinder eyes. You notice what your body can do.

You appreciate its strength and its resilience. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious has received these suggestions. It will remind you of the healthy body.

It will support mindful eating and joyful movement. (Pause 5s) You deserve to feel good in your body. You deserve to eat without guilt and to move without punishment. (Pause 5s)

The healthy body and the balanced scales are within you. Whenever you need to remember, you can see the balance. You can feel the vitality. (Pause 3s)

You are not chasing a number. You are building a way of life. Nourishment, not deprivation. (Pause 5s)

From this day forward, you will approach food and movement with a new mindset. You will ask: does this nourish me? Does this feel good? (Pause 5s)

When you feel the old pull toward restriction or overeating, you can pause. You can breathe. You can return to the image of balance. (Pause 3s)

You recognise that your body has wisdom. It signals hunger. It signals fullness.

You can learn to listen. (Pause 5s) Positive body image is a practice. You may not love every part of yourself overnight.

But you can choose to respect your body. To care for it. To stop criticising it. (Pause 5s)

Your subconscious will support you. It will remind you that you are building sustainable habits. That you are worthy of feeling good. (Pause 3s)

So let this feeling sink in. You can eat mindfully. You can move with joy.

You can have a positive relationship with your body. (Pause 5s) In the days to come, you will notice yourself pausing before you eat. Choosing foods that nourish you.

Moving because it feels good. (Pause 5s) You will notice yourself speaking to your body with more kindness. Not perfect.

But gentler. (Pause 3s) When old habits of guilt or restriction try to return, you can remember the healthy body. The balance.

The vitality. (Pause 5s) You are becoming someone who nourishes themselves. Who moves with joy.

Who respects their body. (Pause 3s) The healthy body is yours. Use it as your guide.

Let it remind you: nourishment, not deprivation. (Pause 5s) You deserve to feel at home in your body. You deserve sustainable habits that last a lifetime. (Pause 3s)

Your mind and body will remember this experience. When you sit down to eat, when you choose to move, they will have a new reference: balance, care, vitality. (Pause 5s) Recognise that one meal does not define you.

One day does not define you. It is the overall pattern that matters. (Pause 3s) If you overeat at a celebration, you can simply return to balance at the next meal.

No guilt. No punishment. Just the next choice. (Pause 5s)

If you miss a walk or a workout, you can move the next day. Consistency over perfection. (Pause 5s) Your body is not your enemy.

It carries you through life. It deserves to be fed well, moved gently, and spoken to with kindness. (Pause 3s) When you look in the mirror, you can choose to notice what your body can do.

It breathes. It walks. It digests.

It heals. (Pause 5s) Sustainable habits are built one choice at a time. A glass of water.

A vegetable. A ten-minute walk. These add up. (Pause 5s)

You are not waiting to be thin to be worthy. You are worthy now. And you are choosing to care for yourself because you matter. (Pause 3s)

The balanced scales in your mind are not about a number. They are about equilibrium: enough food, enough movement, enough rest, enough kindness. (Pause 5s) When you sit down to eat, take a breath first.

Notice the food. Give your body a chance to register hunger and fullness. (Pause 3s) Eating slowly is a form of self-respect.

It allows digestion to work well and allows you to stop when you are satisfied. (Pause 5s) Movement can be woven into your day: stairs instead of the lift, a short walk at lunch, stretching when you wake. It does not have to be dramatic to count. (Pause 5s)

The healthy body is not a destination. It is a way of travelling. You are already on the path when you choose mindful eating, movement, and positive body image. (Pause 3s)

Sustainable habits are built on repetition and self-compassion. You do not need to be perfect. You need to return again and again to balance, to nourishment, and to respect for your body. (Pause 5s)

The imagery of the balanced scale and the healthy body will stay with you. Use them when you choose what to eat, when you choose to move, and when you look in the mirror. (Pause 5s) Mindful eating, movement, positive body image, sustainable habits, nourishment not deprivation: these are the foundations you are building for life. (Pause 3s)

Your body deserves to be nourished and moved with kindness. The healthy body and the balanced scale are your guides. (Pause 5s) You choose nourishment over deprivation.

You choose movement that feels good. You choose to see your body with kindness. Sustainable habits and positive body image are yours to build. (Pause 5s)

Every time you eat mindfully or move with joy, you strengthen this new way of being. The healthy body is not a fantasy; it is a choice you make again and again. Nourishment, not deprivation.

Movement with joy. Positive body image. You are building these into your life.

The balanced scale and the healthy body are with you. Sustainable habits are within your reach. (Pause 5s) So hold on to this feeling as we prepare to bring you back.

You have connected with the healthy body. You have connected with mindful eating, movement, and positive body image. (Pause 5s) You have everything you need to build sustainable habits.

A calm mind. A clear intention. The image of balance and vitality. (Pause 3s)

From this day forward, you choose nourishment over deprivation. You choose movement that feels good. You choose to treat your body with respect. (Pause 5s)

The balanced scales and the healthy body are within you. They represent care, sustainability, and self-respect. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious has received these suggestions.

It will support your mindful eating and your movement in the days and weeks to come. (Pause 5s) You are not on a diet. You are building a way of life.

One meal, one movement, one kind thought at a time. (Pause 3s) So take this gift with you. The gift of the healthy body.

The gift of balance and nourishment. (Pause 5s) You deserve to feel good. You deserve sustainable habits.

The healthy body is yours. Use it. Trust it. (Pause 3s)

Whenever you listen again, the connection will deepen. Your capacity for mindful eating and positive body image will grow. (Pause 5s) You are allowing a part of yourself that knows how to care for your body to take the lead. (Pause 3s)

The balance is yours. The vitality is yours. The feeling of nourishment and respect is yours. (Pause 5s)

So as you go back into your day, carry the healthy body with you. When you eat, when you move, when you look in the mirror, remember: you have this resource. (Pause 3s) You have the ability to eat mindfully.

You have the image of balance. You have the choice to nourish yourself and to move with joy. (Pause 5s) You are building a positive relationship with your body.

You are creating sustainable habits. Believe it. Live it. (Pause 3s)

Your subconscious will remind you. Whenever guilt or old patterns rise, you can return to the healthy body. To the balance.

To nourishment, not deprivation. (Pause 5s) You have taken an important step. You have connected with mindful eating, movement, and positive body image.

Let it guide you. (Pause 3s) So go forward with this balance. With this care.

With the knowledge that you can nourish yourself and feel good in your body. (Pause 5s) Your mind has received this training. It will support you.

You are ready. You can build sustainable habits. Believe it. (Pause 3s)

You have the healthy body. You have the balance. Use them well.

You are worthy of care. Nourishment is your choice. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious holds the image of the healthy body.

It will remind you to eat mindfully, to move with joy, and to respect your body. You have this now. The healthy body is yours.

From this day forward. You are ready. Go in peace."

## Termination

"Now, it is time to gently return to your full waking awareness, bringing with you all the positive feelings of balance, nourishment, and respect for your body. (Pause 3s) I will count from one to five, and with each number, you will feel more and more alert, refreshed, and ready to engage with your day.

One... beginning to feel a gentle energy returning to your body. You are safe and grounded. Two... becoming more aware of your surroundings, feeling grounded and present in the room.

Three... feeling refreshed and invigorated, carrying your newfound sense of balance and the healthy body with you. Four... your mind is clear, your body is energised, and you are ready to open your eyes. And five... eyes open, wide awake, feeling absolutely wonderful, balanced, and ready to embrace your day with mindful eating, joyful movement, and positive body image. (Pause 3s)

Remember: the healthy body is within you. Nourishment, not deprivation. Sustainable habits.

You are worthy of feeling good."

scripts.title: Managing Anxiety
scripts.introduction: This script is designed to help individuals effectively manage and reduce feelings of anxiety, promoting a sense of calm, control, and inner peace. It aims to reprogram anxious thought patterns and cultivate a resilient mindset.
scripts.content:
## Induction - Progressive Relaxation

"As you settle into a comfortable position, allow your eyes to gently close. (Pause 3s) Take a deep, calming breath in through your nose... and as you exhale slowly through your mouth, release any tension you might be holding in your shoulders or your jaw. (Pause 3s) Continue to breathe deeply and evenly, allowing each breath to carry you deeper into relaxation.

With every out-breath, you let go a little more. With every in-breath, you invite calm and stillness. (Pause 5s)

Bring your awareness to your feet. Notice the weight of your feet resting on the floor or the surface beneath you. Feel your toes relaxing... each toe letting go of any tension.

Feel the soles of your feet becoming soft and heavy. Feel your heels sinking... your ankles releasing. (Pause 3s) Let this wave of relaxation move slowly up through your calves, your shins, and your knees.

Your legs feel heavy and relaxed, as if they are gently melting into the support beneath you. (Pause 5s)

Feel your thighs relaxing, becoming soft and loose. This soothing sensation continues into your hips and your lower back, releasing any stiffness or holding. Your abdomen softens... your stomach muscles letting go completely.

Your chest relaxes with each gentle breath. (Pause 3s) Feel the relaxation spreading up your spine, vertebra by vertebra... through your shoulders, and down your arms to your elbows, your forearms, your wrists, and your fingertips. Your arms are loose and heavy. (Pause 5s)

Your neck relaxes... your jaw unclenches... your tongue rests gently in your mouth... your facial muscles soften... your forehead is smooth and calm. Your eyelids feel wonderfully heavy. (Pause 3s) You are now deeply relaxed, peaceful, and calm.

Your whole body feels supported. Your mind is becoming still. (Pause 5s) Every time you breathe out, you go a little deeper.

Deeper and deeper into this safe, comfortable state of relaxation. Nothing can disturb you here. You are safe.

You are at ease. (Pause 5s)"

## Deepener - The Calm Centre

"Imagine yourself in a place of complete safety. Perhaps a quiet room with soft light, or a sheltered harbour where the water is still. (Pause 3s) This is your calm centre.

Nothing can reach you here unless you allow it. (Pause 3s) The walls are strong. The space is yours.

You feel grounded. You feel safe. (Pause 5s) Your breath slows.

Your heart rate steadies. In this place, anxiety has no power. It is simply a pattern.

Not who you are. (Pause 5s) You notice the sensation of your feet on the ground. The support beneath you.

The air in your lungs. (Pause 3s) This is the calm centre. A place you can return to whenever you need.

A place of safety, breath, and control. (Pause 5s) Let this feeling draw you deeper. You are safe.

You are calm. You have a centre that cannot be shaken. (Pause 5s)"

## Therapeutic Content

"Now, in this safe space, recognise that anxiety is a pattern. Not your identity. (Pause 3s) You are not an anxious person.

You are a person who sometimes experiences anxiety. And you can learn to manage it. (Pause 5s) Any old belief that anxiety defines you, or that you are powerless against it, simply softens and fades.

In its place, a calm understanding grows: you can ground yourself. You can breathe. You can choose calm. (Pause 5s)

Grounding becomes natural. When anxiety rises, you can feel your feet on the floor. You can notice five things you see, four you hear, three you touch.

You can come back to the present moment. (Pause 3s) Your breath is your anchor. A slow breath in.

A slow breath out. You do not have to fight the anxiety. You can breathe through it. (Pause 5s)

You have calm control. Not the absence of feeling, but the ability to respond rather than be overwhelmed. (Pause 5s) From this moment forward, you will find it easier to recognise anxiety as a pattern.

You will notice it. You will not fuse with it. You will ground yourself and breathe. (Pause 3s)

Resilience is already within you. You have faced difficult moments before. You can face them again, with new tools. (Pause 5s)

The calm centre is always available. In a meeting. In a queue.

In the middle of the night. You can return to it. You can feel your feet.

You can breathe. (Pause 5s) You recognise that anxiety is often the body's alarm system. Sometimes it is helpful.

Sometimes it is oversensitive. You can acknowledge the signal without being ruled by it. (Pause 3s) See yourself in a situation that used to trigger anxiety.

This time, you pause. You feel your feet. You take a breath.

You remember: I have a calm centre. (Pause 5s) See yourself breathing through a wave of anxiety. You do not fight it.

You do not panic. You breathe. It passes. (Pause 5s)

See yourself in the months to come... stronger. More resilient. Calmer.

You have practised. You have a place to return to. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious has received these suggestions.

It will remind you of the calm centre. It will support grounding and breath when anxiety rises. (Pause 5s) You deserve to feel calm.

You deserve to know that anxiety does not define you. (Pause 5s) The calm centre is within you. Whenever you need it, you can close your eyes and see the safe place.

You can feel your feet. You can breathe. (Pause 3s) You are not denying that anxiety exists.

You are choosing to respond with grounding, breath, and the knowledge that you have control. (Pause 5s) From this day forward, you will approach anxiety with a new mindset. You will name it: this is anxiety.

This is a pattern. I can breathe. I can ground myself. (Pause 5s)

When you feel the first signs of anxietyracing heart, tight chest, spiralling thoughtsyou can pause. You can return to the calm centre. You can breathe. (Pause 3s)

You recognise that emotional regulation is a skill. You are building it. Each time you ground yourself, each time you breathe through anxiety, you strengthen it. (Pause 5s)

Inner peace is not the absence of difficulty. It is the ability to find a still point within difficulty. You have that still point.

The calm centre. (Pause 5s) Your subconscious will support you. It will remind you that you have practised this.

That you have a place of safety. (Pause 3s) So let this feeling sink in. Anxiety is a pattern.

You have tools. You have the calm centre. You can breathe.

You can ground yourself. (Pause 5s) In the days to come, you will notice yourself pausing when anxiety rises. You will feel your feet.

You will breathe. You will remember: I am not my anxiety. (Pause 5s) You will notice yourself feeling more resilient.

Not because life is easier, but because you have a way to respond. (Pause 3s) When old patterns of panic or avoidance try to return, you can return to the calm centre. To the breath.

To the ground beneath your feet. (Pause 5s) You are becoming someone who can manage anxiety. Who can stay grounded.

Who can choose calm. (Pause 3s) The calm centre is yours. Use it whenever you need it.

Let it remind you: you are safe. You can breathe. You have control. (Pause 5s)

You deserve to live without being overwhelmed by anxiety. You deserve calm and resilience. (Pause 3s) Your mind and body will remember this experience.

When anxiety knocks, they will have a new reference: the calm centre, the breath, the ground. (Pause 5s) Anxiety often lives in the future: what if this happens, what if that happens. Grounding brings you back to now. (Pause 3s)

Right now, in this moment, you are often safe. Your feet are on the floor. You can breathe.

You can look around and name what you see. (Pause 5s) The more you practise returning to the calm centre, the faster you will be able to access it. It becomes a reflex. (Pause 5s)

You do not have to explain your anxiety to anyone unless you choose to. You can simply use your tools: breath, ground, calm centre. (Pause 3s) If you need to leave a situation to breathe, that is okay.

Stepping away is not weakness. It is self-care. (Pause 5s) Resilience does not mean you never struggle.

It means you have a way back. You have the calm centre. You have the breath.

You have the ground beneath your feet. (Pause 5s) Your subconscious will continue to absorb these suggestions. Each time you listen, the pathway to calm becomes stronger. (Pause 3s)

You can use the calm centre in any situation: before a difficult conversation, before a presentation, in a crowded place, or alone in the night. (Pause 5s) The safe harbour and the calm centre are the same idea: a place inside you where you are safe, where you can breathe, where you have control. (Pause 5s) Anxiety may still visit.

But it no longer has to move in. You can acknowledge it, use your tools, and return to calm. (Pause 3s) You are building resilience not by avoiding difficulty but by knowing you have a way through it. (Pause 5s)

Anxiety as pattern not identity, grounding, breath, calm control, resilience: these ideas are now part of your inner toolkit. (Pause 3s) The calm centre is your refuge. Whenever the world feels overwhelming, you can return to it.

You can feel your feet. You can breathe. (Pause 5s) You have trained your mind to recognise anxiety as a pattern and to access grounding, breath, and calm control.

That training will stay with you. (Pause 3s) When anxiety appears, you will recognise it as a pattern, ground yourself, breathe, and return to the calm centre. You have resilience.

You have calm control. (Pause 5s) The calm centre is always there. Anxiety is a pattern, not your identity.

You can ground yourself, breathe, and find that place of safety and calm whenever you need it. (Pause 5s) Your subconscious has received these suggestions. Anxiety as pattern not identity, grounding, breath, calm control, and resilience are now part of how you respond to difficulty.

The calm centre is your refuge. You can return to it at any time. You are safe there.

You can breathe there. You have calm control. You have resilience.

Anxiety does not define you; your response to it does. The calm centre is yours. Ground yourself.

Breathe. You have a place of safety and calm. You can manage anxiety.

Your calm centre is always available. (Pause 5s) So hold on to this feeling as we prepare to bring you back. You have connected with the calm centre.

You have connected with grounding, breath, and calm control. (Pause 5s) You have everything you need to manage anxiety. A calm centre.

A breath. The knowledge that anxiety is a pattern, not your identity. (Pause 3s) From this day forward, you choose to ground yourself.

You choose to breathe. You choose to return to the calm centre when you need it. (Pause 5s) The safe place and the calm centre are within you.

They represent safety, breath, and resilience. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious has received these suggestions. It will support your grounding and your breath in the days and weeks to come. (Pause 5s)

You are not trying to never feel anxious. You are building the ability to respond with calm. (Pause 3s) So take this gift with you.

The gift of the calm centre. The gift of grounding and breath. (Pause 5s) You deserve to feel calm.

You deserve to know that you can manage anxiety. The calm centre is yours. Use it.

Trust it. (Pause 3s) Whenever you listen again, the connection will deepen. Your capacity for calm and resilience will grow. (Pause 5s)

You are allowing a part of yourself that can stay grounded and calm to take the lead. (Pause 3s) The calm centre is yours. The breath is yours.

The feeling of safety and control is yours. (Pause 5s) So as you go back into your day, carry the calm centre with you. When anxiety rises, remember: you have this resource. (Pause 3s)

You have the ability to ground yourself. You have the breath. You have the choice to return to calm. (Pause 5s)

You can manage anxiety. You have a calm centre. You are resilient.

Believe it. Live it. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious will remind you.

Whenever anxiety knocks, you can return to the calm centre. To the breath. To the ground beneath your feet. (Pause 5s)

You have taken an important step. You have connected with the calm centre and with your ability to manage anxiety. Let it guide you. (Pause 3s)

So go forward with this calm. With this resilience. With the knowledge that you can ground yourself and breathe through anxiety. (Pause 5s)

Your mind has received this training. It will support you. You are ready.

You can manage anxiety. Believe it. (Pause 3s) You have the calm centre.

You have the breath. Use them well. You are not your anxiety.

You have control. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious holds the image of the calm centre. It will remind you to ground yourself and to breathe.

You have this now. The calm centre is yours. From this day forward.

You are ready. Go in peace."

## Termination

"Now, it is time to gently return to your full waking awareness, bringing with you all the positive feelings of calm, safety, and resilience. (Pause 3s) I will count from one to five, and with each number, you will feel more and more alert, refreshed, and ready to engage with your day.

One... beginning to feel a gentle energy returning to your body. You are safe and grounded. Two... becoming more aware of your surroundings, feeling grounded and present in the room.

Three... feeling refreshed and invigorated, carrying your calm centre and your ability to manage anxiety with you. Four... your mind is clear, your body is energised, and you are ready to open your eyes. And five... eyes open, wide awake, feeling absolutely wonderful, calm, and ready to embrace your day with grounding, breath, and resilience. (Pause 3s)

Remember: the calm centre is within you. Anxiety is a pattern, not your identity. You can breathe.

You can stay calm."

scripts.title: Overcoming Anger
scripts.introduction: This script is designed to help individuals manage and overcome feelings of anger, transforming reactive responses into calm, constructive communication and inner peace. It aims to reprogram the subconscious mind for emotional regulation and resilience.
scripts.content:
## Induction - Progressive Relaxation

"As you settle into a comfortable position, allow your eyes to gently close. (Pause 3s) Take a deep, calming breath in through your nose... and as you exhale slowly through your mouth, release any tension you might be holding in your shoulders or your jaw. With every out-breath, you let go a little more. With every in-breath, you invite calm and stillness. (Pause 5s)

Bring your awareness to your feet. Notice the weight of your feet resting on the floor or the surface beneath you. Feel your toes relaxing... each toe letting go of any tension.

Feel the soles of your feet becoming soft and heavy. Feel your heels sinking... your ankles releasing. (Pause 3s) Let this wave of relaxation move slowly up through your calves, your shins, and your knees.

Your legs feel heavy and relaxed, as if they are gently melting into the support beneath you. (Pause 5s)

Feel your thighs relaxing, becoming soft and loose. This soothing sensation continues into your hips and your lower back, releasing any stiffness or holding. Your abdomen softens... your stomach muscles letting go completely.

Your chest relaxes with each gentle breath. (Pause 3s) Feel the relaxation spreading up your spine, vertebra by vertebra... through your shoulders, and down your arms to your elbows, your forearms, your wrists, and your fingertips. Your arms are loose and heavy. (Pause 5s)

Deeper and deeper into this safe, comfortable state of relaxation. Nothing can disturb you here. You are safe.

You are at ease. (Pause 5s)"

## Deepener - The Peaceful Clearing

"Imagine yourself stepping into a peaceful clearing. Perhaps in a forest, or beside a still pool of cool water. (Pause 3s) The clearing is open.

There is space around you. No pressure. No crowding. (Pause 3s)

You feel a cool, gentle breeze. It touches your skin. It cools any heat.

It brings a sense of spaciousness. (Pause 5s) In this clearing, you have room to breathe. Room to think.

Room to choose how you respond. (Pause 5s) Perhaps you dip your hands into the cool water. The coolness spreads.

Your body relaxes. Your mind clears. (Pause 3s) This is the peaceful clearing.

A place of cooling. A place of space. A place where you can pause before you react. (Pause 5s)

Let this feeling draw you deeper. You have space. You have coolness.

You have the ability to find peace before you speak or act. (Pause 5s)"

## Therapeutic Content

"Now, in this peaceful space, recognise that you can choose to pause before you react. (Pause 3s) Anger is a feeling. It does not have to become an action.

You can feel the heat, and then you can breathe. You can find the peaceful clearing. (Pause 5s) Any old patterns of snapping, shouting, or saying things you regret simply soften and fade.

In their place, a calm control grows: you can pause. You can breathe. You can choose your response. (Pause 5s)

Constructive communication becomes natural. You express what you need without attacking. You listen.

You seek to understand before you seek to be understood. (Pause 3s) You recognise that the pause is your power. Between the trigger and the response, there is a space.

In that space, you can choose. (Pause 5s) Emotional regulation is a skill. You are building it.

Each time you pause, each time you breathe before you react, you strengthen it. (Pause 5s) From this moment forward, you will find it easier to pause before reacting. You will feel the rise of anger, and you will take a breath.

You will find the peaceful clearing. The cool waters. The space. (Pause 3s)

Inner peace is not the absence of frustration. It is the ability to feel frustration without being consumed by it. You can feel it.

You can let it cool. You can respond with clarity. (Pause 5s) You deserve to communicate in ways that respect yourself and others.

You deserve to feel in control of your reactions. (Pause 5s) The peaceful clearing is within you. Whenever you feel anger rising, you can close your eyes and see the clearing.

Feel the cool breeze. Feel the space. (Pause 3s) You are not denying that you feel angry.

You are choosing not to let anger dictate your behaviour. (Pause 5s) From this day forward, you will approach conflict with a new mindset. You will pause.

You will breathe. You will ask yourself: what do I need to say? How can I say it without harm? (Pause 5s)

When you feel the first flush of angerthe heat, the urge to snapyou can stop. You can find the peaceful clearing. You can breathe.

You can choose. (Pause 3s) You recognise that constructive communication often means saying less in the moment and more when you are calm. (Pause 5s) You can take a break.

You can say, I need a moment. You can return when you are ready to speak without attack. (Pause 5s) Your subconscious has received these suggestions.

It will remind you of the peaceful clearing. It will support the pause before you react. (Pause 3s) See yourself in a situation that used to trigger anger.

This time, you feel the heat. You pause. You breathe.

You find the clearing. You respond with calm. (Pause 5s) See yourself in a difficult conversation.

You do not interrupt. You do not raise your voice. You speak clearly and respectfully. (Pause 5s)

See yourself in the months to come... relationships feeling safer. Fewer regrets. More inner peace. (Pause 3s)

So let this feeling sink in. You can pause. You can breathe.

You can choose constructive communication. You can find the peaceful clearing. (Pause 5s) In the days to come, you will notice yourself pausing when anger rises.

You will feel the coolness. You will feel the space. (Pause 5s) You will notice yourself speaking with more care.

Listening with more patience. (Pause 3s) When old patterns of reactivity try to return, you can return to the peaceful clearing. To the cool waters.

To the breath. (Pause 5s) You are becoming someone who can regulate your emotions. Who can pause before reacting.

Who can communicate constructively. (Pause 3s) The peaceful clearing is yours. Use it whenever you feel the heat of anger.

Let it remind you: I have space. I can cool down. I can choose. (Pause 5s)

You deserve to feel at peace. You deserve to express yourself without damaging yourself or others. (Pause 3s) Your mind and body will remember this experience.

When anger rises, they will have a new reference: the peaceful clearing, the pause, the breath. (Pause 5s) Anger is often a signal. Something matters to you.

Something feels unfair or threatened. You can honour that signal without letting it control your behaviour. (Pause 3s) After you have cooled down, you can still address the issue.

You can say what you need to say. But you say it from the peaceful clearing, not from the heat of the moment. (Pause 5s) Constructive communication often starts with I feel rather than you always or you never.

It invites dialogue instead of attack. (Pause 5s) If someone else is angry, you do not have to meet their intensity. You can stay in your clearing.

You can breathe. You can respond when they have calmed down. (Pause 3s) The cool waters are always available.

In your mind, you can dip your hands in. You can feel the coolness spreading. You can create space between the trigger and your response. (Pause 5s)

Every time you pause and choose rather than react, you strengthen this new pattern. Your subconscious learns: I can handle this. I have the peaceful clearing. (Pause 5s)

The cool waters are always there. You can imagine them anytime: cool, clear, calming. They cool the heat in your chest and your face. (Pause 3s)

Inner peace is not the absence of strong feelings. It is the ability to feel them without being swept away. You can feel anger and still choose your behaviour. (Pause 5s)

When you communicate constructively, you protect your relationships and your self-respect. You say what needs to be said without the poison of attack. (Pause 5s) Pause before reacting, constructive communication, emotional regulation, inner peace: these are the pillars you are building. (Pause 3s)

The peaceful clearing and the cool waters are always available. In a traffic jam, in a difficult meeting, at home when someone pushes your buttonsyou can find the clearing. You can breathe.

You can choose. (Pause 5s) You are rewiring your response to frustration and conflict. Instead of instant reaction, you have the pause.

Instead of attack, you have constructive communication. Instead of being ruled by anger, you have emotional regulation and inner peace. (Pause 5s) The peaceful clearing gives you space.

The cool waters cool the heat. You pause before reacting. You communicate constructively.

You choose inner peace. (Pause 3s) When anger rises, you do not have to act on it. You can step into the peaceful clearing.

You can feel the cool waters. You can take a breath and choose your response with clarity and respect for yourself and others. (Pause 5s) Pause before reacting.

Constructive communication. Emotional regulation. Inner peace.

These are the gifts of the peaceful clearing and the cool waters. Your subconscious will remind you of them when you need them most. (Pause 5s) The peaceful clearing and the cool waters give you space and cooling.

You no longer have to react in the heat of the moment. You can pause, breathe, and choose constructive communication and inner peace. Emotional regulation is your choice.

The peaceful clearing is always there when you need it. Pause before reacting. Choose constructive communication.

Find inner peace. The cool waters cool the heat. The peaceful clearing gives you space to choose.

The gift of the peaceful clearing. The gift of the pause and the cool waters. (Pause 5s) You deserve to feel at peace.

You deserve to communicate without regret. The peaceful clearing is yours. Use it.

scripts.title: Cultivating Empathy
scripts.introduction: This script is designed to help individuals cultivate greater empathy, fostering understanding, compassion, and deeper connections with others. It aims to expand perspective-taking abilities and enhance emotional intelligence.
scripts.content:
## Induction - Progressive Relaxation

"As you settle into a comfortable position, allow your eyes to gently close. (Pause 3s) Take a deep, calming breath in through your nose... and as you exhale slowly through your mouth, release any tension you might be holding in your shoulders or your jaw. (Pause 3s) Continue to breathe deeply and evenly, allowing each breath to carry you deeper into relaxation.

With every out-breath, you let go a little more. With every in-breath, you invite calm and stillness. (Pause 5s)

Bring your awareness to your feet. Notice the weight of your feet resting on the floor or the surface beneath you. Feel your toes relaxing... each toe letting go of any tension.

Feel the soles of your feet becoming soft and heavy. Feel your heels sinking... your ankles releasing. (Pause 3s) Let this wave of relaxation move slowly up through your calves, your shins, and your knees.

Your legs feel heavy and relaxed, as if they are gently melting into the support beneath you. (Pause 5s)

Feel your thighs relaxing, becoming soft and loose. This soothing sensation continues into your hips and your lower back, releasing any stiffness or holding. Your abdomen softens... your stomach muscles letting go completely.

Your chest relaxes with each gentle breath. (Pause 3s) Feel the relaxation spreading up your spine, vertebra by vertebra... through your shoulders, and down your arms to your elbows, your forearms, your wrists, and your fingertips. Your arms are loose and heavy. (Pause 5s)

Your neck relaxes... your jaw unclenches... your tongue rests gently in your mouth... your facial muscles soften... your forehead is smooth and calm. Your eyelids feel wonderfully heavy. (Pause 3s) You are now deeply relaxed, peaceful, and calm.

Your whole body feels supported. Your mind is becoming still. (Pause 5s) Every time you breathe out, you go a little deeper.

Deeper and deeper into this safe, comfortable state of relaxation. Nothing can disturb you here. You are safe.

You are at ease. (Pause 5s)"

## Deepener - The Bridge of Understanding

"Imagine yourself standing at one end of a beautiful, ancient bridge. The bridge stretches across a gentle river, connecting two shores. (Pause 3s) The wood is warm beneath your feet.

The air is soft. You are safe here. (Pause 3s) You begin to walk slowly across the bridge.

With each step, you feel your mind opening. You are not alone on this bridge. (Pause 5s) Halfway across, you pause.

You look at the other shore. You imagine someone else standing theresomeone whose life, whose feelings, whose perspective is different from your own. (Pause 5s) For a moment, you allow yourself to see through their eyes.

To feel what they might feel. Not to become them, but to understand. (Pause 3s) The bridge is a place of connection.

Of perspective-taking. Of compassion. (Pause 5s) You feel a gentle warmth in your chestthe warmth of empathy.

The bridge of understanding is within you now. You can cross it whenever you wish to connect more deeply with another. (Pause 5s)"

## Therapeutic Content

"Now, in this relaxed state, feel a deep sense of empathy awakening within you. (Pause 3s) You recognise that every person has their own story, their own struggles, their own way of seeing the world. Perspective-taking becomes natural to you. (Pause 5s)

Any old habits of quick judgement, defensiveness, or seeing only your own point of view simply soften and fade. In their place, curiosity and compassion grow. (Pause 5s) Imagine yourself in a situation where you might have once felt frustrated or distant from someone.

Perhaps a colleague who behaves differently. Perhaps a family member who seems difficult. (Pause 3s) See yourself pausing.

Taking a breath. Asking yourself: what might it be like to be in their shoes? What might they be carrying that I cannot see? (Pause 5s)

You do not have to agree with everyone. But you can choose to understand. Understanding deepens connection.

It reduces conflict. It allows you to respond with emotional intelligence rather than react from your own hurt or impatience. (Pause 5s) From this moment forward, you will find it easier to cultivate empathy in all areas of your life.

You will instinctively listen before judging. You will seek to see the world from another's perspective. (Pause 3s) Your relationships will benefit.

People will feel heard and valued in your presence. You will feel less isolated, because connection grows when we truly see one another. (Pause 5s) When you feel the old urge to dismiss or criticise, you can picture the bridge.

You can ask: what would it be like to stand in their shoes? (Pause 5s) You are becoming a person of genuine empathy. A source of understanding in a world that often rushes to judge. (Pause 3s)

See yourself tomorrow... in a conversation that might once have left you irritated. This time, you listen. You wonder.

You respond with compassion. (Pause 5s) See yourself next week... when someone shares something difficult. Instead of offering quick advice, you offer presence.

You acknowledge their feelings. You let them know they are not alone. (Pause 5s) See yourself in the months to come... your connections deepening because you are willing to see from another's point of view.

You give others the gift of being understood. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious has received these suggestions. It will remind you of the bridge.

It will help you choose empathy when the old habit of judgement tries to return. (Pause 5s) Empathy is not weakness. It is a strength.

It builds trust. It opens doors. It allows you to navigate conflict with grace. (Pause 5s)

So let this feeling of empathy sink in. You have the capacity to understand. You have the capacity to connect. (Pause 3s)

The bridge of understanding is within you. Whenever you need to remember, you can close your eyes and see yourself walking across it. (Pause 5s) You deserve to feel connected.

You deserve to give and receive the gift of being seen. (Pause 3s) From this day forward, empathy is a choice you can make. You are building a life of deeper connection.

One conversation at a time. (Pause 5s) In difficult conversations, you will find yourself pausing to consider the other person's experience. You will use phrases that show you are trying to understand.

You will ask questions instead of assuming. (Pause 5s) At work, you will recognise that colleagues have pressures and histories you may not see. You will communicate with respect and openness. (Pause 3s)

With family and friends, you will listen with your full attention. You will remember that everyone is fighting a battle you may know nothing about. (Pause 5s) When someone hurts you, you can still set boundaries.

But you can also wonder what pain might be driving their behaviour. Understanding does not mean accepting harm. It means responding with clarity and compassion. (Pause 5s)

Your subconscious is now aligned with empathy. It will remind you of the bridge. It will help you step into another's shoes before you react. (Pause 3s)

Let that truth settle in. You are a person who can understand. You are learning to see from multiple perspectives.

You have this resource now. Use it well. (Pause 3s) The bridge is yours.

It will always be there when you want to connect more deeply. You are capable of empathy. You are capable of compassion. (Pause 3s)

When someone is rude, you can wonder what kind of day they are having. When someone disagrees with you, you can listen to why. When someone is quiet, you can offer space instead of pressure. (Pause 5s)

Empathy is a gift you give yourself as much as others. It reduces your own frustration. It deepens your relationships.

It makes you someone people trust. (Pause 5s) You may have been told that empathy matters. Now you are making it a practice. (Pause 3s)

Every time you choose to understand before you judge, you strengthen this new habit. Your subconscious is learning: I can see from another's view. I can connect. (Pause 5s)

The world will still have people who are hard to understand. Your job is not to fix them. Your job is to offer the gift of being heard and seen. (Pause 3s)

Each time you succeed, you prove to yourself that empathy is possible. That you can do this. That the bridge of understanding is real. (Pause 5s)

So hold on to this feeling as we prepare to bring you back. You have connected with the bridge. You have connected with empathy. (Pause 5s)

Your mind and body will remember. When judgement rises, you can answer with a breath. With the image of the bridge.

With the question: what might it be like for them? (Pause 3s) You deserve to feel this connection. You deserve to give and receive understanding.

The bridge is yours. Use it. Trust it.

You are an empathetic person now. (Pause 3s) Whenever you listen to this script again, the connection to the bridge will deepen. Your capacity for empathy will grow. (Pause 5s)

You are not becoming someone else. You are allowing a part of yourself that has always had the capacity for compassion to take the lead. (Pause 3s) Emotional intelligence includes the ability to recognise and understand the feelings of others.

You are strengthening that ability now. (Pause 5s) The bridge is yours. The ability to see from another's perspective is yours.

The feeling of deeper connection is yours. (Pause 3s) So as you go back into your day, carry the bridge with you. When you feel the first flicker of judgement, pause.

Breathe. Remember the other shore. (Pause 5s) You have everything you need to be empathetic.

You have this experience. You have the image of the bridge. You have the choice, from now on, to understand before you react. (Pause 3s)

Let that truth guide you. You are capable of empathy. You are capable of connection.

You can stand in another's shoes when you choose to. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious has received these suggestions. It will support your empathy in the days and weeks to come. (Pause 5s)

When you are in conflict, when you are confused by someone's behaviour, or when you simply want to connect more deeply, you can return to this feeling. You can remember the bridge. (Pause 5s) You deserve to have rich, meaningful connections.

You deserve the peace that comes from understanding others. (Pause 3s) The bridge has opened something in you. That opening is permanent.

You are an empathetic person. Believe it. Live it. (Pause 5s)

And whenever the world tempts you to judge quickly, you can smile inwardly. You know another way. You know the way of the bridge.

You choose empathy. Again and again. You choose connection. (Pause 3s)

So take this gift with you. The gift of empathy. The gift of the bridge of understanding. (Pause 5s)

Your mind and body have learned something today. They will remember. When you need to understand someone, you will know how.

When you need to connect, you will have the bridge. (Pause 3s) You are building a life of deeper connection. One empathetic moment at a time.

The bridge is within you. You can cross it whenever you wish. You understand.

You connect. You are free to choose empathy. (Pause 3s) From this day forward, let the bridge guide you.

When you feel distant from someone, picture the bridge. When you feel frustrated, take a breath and ask: what might it be like for them? (Pause 5s) You have trained your mind for empathy.

That training will stay with you. (Pause 3s) Honour this change. Use it.

You deserve to live with deeper connections. The bridge is yours for life. (Pause 3s) And as we bring you back to full awareness, hold on to that feeling.

You are connected. You can understand. You do not have to stay in your own shoes alone. (Pause 5s)

Your subconscious will remind you. Whenever judgement rises, you can return to the bridge. To the other shore.

To the peace of understanding. (Pause 3s) You are an empathetic person. You have connected with that truth today.

Trust that. Live that. The bridge is there.

You can cross it. You choose empathy. (Pause 3s) The bridge is part of you now.

It will be there whenever you close your eyes and seek connection. (Pause 5s) You have taken an important step. You have connected with empathy.

Let it guide you. Let it deepen your relationships. You deserve this connection.

You have the capacity for it. The bridge of understanding is always with you. (Pause 3s) So go forward into your day with this openness.

With this empathy. With the knowledge that you can see from another's point of view. (Pause 5s) Your mind has received this training.

It will support you. You are ready. You are empathetic.

Believe it. (Pause 3s) You have the bridge. You have empathy.

Use them well. You are connected. The other's shoes are there when you choose to step into them. (Pause 3s)

Your subconscious holds the image of the bridge. It will remind you to pause and understand. You are an empathetic person.

Trust yourself. You have this now. The bridge is yours.

Empathy is your choice. From this day forward. You are ready.

You are understanding. (Pause 3s) Perspective-taking is a skill that deepens with practice. Each time you ask yourself what another person might be feeling or thinking, you strengthen your emotional intelligence.

You become someone who builds bridges rather than walls. (Pause 5s) Go in peace."

## Termination

"Now, it is time to gently return to your full waking awareness, bringing with you all the positive feelings of empathy, understanding, and connection. (Pause 3s) I will count from one to five, and with each number, you will feel more and more alert, refreshed, and ready to engage with your day.

One... beginning to feel a gentle energy returning to your body. You are safe and grounded. Two... becoming more aware of your surroundings, feeling grounded and present in the room.

Three... feeling refreshed and invigorated, carrying your capacity for empathy with you into your day. Four... your mind is clear, your body is energised, and you are ready to open your eyes. And five... eyes open, wide awake, feeling absolutely wonderful, connected, and ready to embrace your day with understanding and compassion. (Pause 3s)

Remember: the bridge of understanding is within you. You can see from another's point of view."

scripts.title: Coping with Grief and Loss
scripts.introduction: This script is designed to help individuals navigate the complex emotions associated with grief and loss, offering comfort, acceptance, and a pathway towards healing. It aims to support the natural grieving process and foster resilience.
scripts.content:
## Induction - Progressive Relaxation

"As you settle into a comfortable position, allow your eyes to gently close. (Pause 3s) Take a deep, calming breath in through your nose... and as you exhale slowly through your mouth, release any tension you might be holding in your shoulders or your jaw.
