Deeper and deeper into this safe, comfortable state of relaxation. Nothing can disturb you here. You are safe.

You are at ease. (Pause 5s)"

## Deepener - The Gentle Garden of Memory

"Imagine yourself in a quiet, gentle garden. The light is softnot harsh. The air is warm and still. (Pause 3s)

This is a safe place. A place where you can be with your memories without being overwhelmed. (Pause 3s) In this garden, there are flowers that bloom in their own time.

Some are in full bloom. Some are still budding. There is no rush. (Pause 5s)

You notice a soft lighta gentle, loving lightthat seems to fill the garden. It does not erase the shadows. It simply holds them with kindness. (Pause 5s)

In this garden, grief is allowed. Sadness is allowed. So too is love.

Memory. And the slow, gentle process of healing. (Pause 3s) You are not here to get over anything quickly.

You are here to be held. To remember. To carry love forward in your own time. (Pause 5s)

The gentle garden of memory is within you now. You can return whenever you need a safe place for your grief. (Pause 5s)"

## Therapeutic Content

"Now, in this safe and gentle space, allow yourself to acknowledge that grief is a natural response to loss. (Pause 3s) You are not broken because you grieve. You are human.

Grief is the price of love. It is also the proof of love. (Pause 5s) This experience is not here to cure your grief.

It is here to offer comfort. To offer a soft place to rest when the weight of loss feels heavy. (Pause 5s) You may have been told to move on, to get over it, to be strong.

But healing does not follow a timetable. You are allowed to heal at your own pace. (Pause 3s) Imagine yourself carrying your love for what or whom you have lost.

That love does not disappear. It can live on in youin your heart, in your memories, in the way you choose to live. (Pause 5s) You do not have to let go of love to heal.

You can carry it forward. You can honour the past whilst still moving gently into the future. (Pause 5s) From this moment forward, you give yourself permission to grieve when grief rises.

You give yourself permission to feel moments of peace when they come. (Pause 3s) There is no right way to grieve. Some days will be harder.

Some days will be lighter. Both are part of the journey. (Pause 5s) When you feel overwhelmed, you can picture the gentle garden.

You can feel the soft light. You can remember that you are safe to feel what you feel. (Pause 5s) You are not alone in your grief.

Many have walked this path. You are allowed to take your time. (Pause 3s) See yourself in the days to come... when a wave of sadness arrives.

This time, you do not fight it. You allow it. You breathe.

You know it will pass, and that it is okay that it came. (Pause 5s) See yourself in the weeks to come... finding small moments of comfort. Perhaps in a memory.

Perhaps in the support of someone who cares. Perhaps in the gentle garden itself. (Pause 5s) See yourself in the months to come... carrying your love forward.

Not forgetting. Not getting over. But living alongside your loss with a little more ease. (Pause 3s)

Your subconscious has received these suggestions. It will remind you of the garden when you need a safe place. It will help you be gentle with yourself. (Pause 5s)

Grief is not something to be fixed. It is something to be witnessed. To be held.

To be allowed. (Pause 5s) So let this feeling of comfort sink in. You deserve to be gentle with yourself.

You deserve to heal at your own pace. (Pause 3s) The gentle garden is within you. Whenever you need to remember, you can close your eyes and see the soft light.

Feel the safe space. (Pause 5s) You deserve to feel supported. You deserve to carry your love forward without pressure to move on before you are ready. (Pause 3s)

From this day forward, you can return to this place whenever grief feels too heavy. You are building a relationship with your loss that is kind. That allows time. (Pause 5s)

When someone tells you that you should be over it by now, you can remember: my healing has its own rhythm. I am allowed to take my time. (Pause 5s) When you feel guilty for having a good moment, you can remember: joy and grief can coexist.

A moment of peace does not mean you have forgotten. (Pause 3s) With family and friends who also grieve, you can offer the same gentleness you are learning to offer yourself. You can listen.

You can remember together. (Pause 5s) When the anniversary of a loss approaches, you can prepare. You can create space.

You can return to the garden. (Pause 5s) Your subconscious is now aligned with self-compassion in grief. It will remind you of the garden.

It will help you avoid the trap of judging your own healing. (Pause 3s) Let that truth settle in. You are allowed to grieve.

You are allowed to heal slowly. You have this safe place now. Use it when you need it. (Pause 3s)

The garden is yours. The soft light is yours. The permission to feel is yours. (Pause 3s)

When you cry, you are not weak. You are human. When you laugh, you are not disloyal.

You are alive. When you need to be alone, that is okay. When you need company, that is okay too. (Pause 5s)

Grief is not a problem to be solved. It is an experience to be lived through, with as much kindness as you can offer yourself. (Pause 5s) You may have felt pressure to get over your loss.

Now you can give yourself the gift of time. (Pause 3s) Every time you allow yourself to feel without judgement, you strengthen your capacity to heal. Your subconscious is learning: I can grieve and still be okay.

I can carry love forward. (Pause 5s) The world will sometimes be impatient with grief. Your job is not to meet their timetable.

Your job is to be gentle with yourself. (Pause 3s) Each time you return to the garden in your mind, you prove to yourself that you have a safe place. That you can cope.

That healing is possible in its own time. (Pause 5s) So hold on to this feeling as we prepare to bring you back. You have connected with the gentle garden.

You have connected with comfort. (Pause 5s) Your mind and body will remember. When grief feels overwhelming, you can return to the soft light.

To the safe space. To the knowledge that you are allowed to heal at your own pace. (Pause 3s) You deserve to feel supported in your grief.

You deserve to carry your love forward without being told to get over it. The garden is yours. Use it.

Trust it. (Pause 3s) Whenever you listen to this script again, the connection to the garden will deepen. Your capacity to comfort yourself will grow. (Pause 5s)

You are not failing because you still grieve. You are human. You are loving.

You are healing. (Pause 3s) The gentle garden of memory does not ask you to forget. It asks you to remember with kindness.

To hold your loss and your love with tenderness. (Pause 5s) The garden is yours. The soft light is yours.

The permission to take your time is yours. (Pause 3s) So as you go back into your day, carry the garden with you. When grief rises, you can close your eyes for a moment and see the soft light.

Feel the safe space. (Pause 5s) You have everything you need to cope with your grief. You have this experience.

You have the image of the garden. You have the right to heal at your own pace. (Pause 3s) Let that truth guide you.

You are allowed to grieve. You are allowed to heal slowly. You are allowed to carry love forward. (Pause 3s)

Your subconscious has received these suggestions. It will support you in the days and weeks to come. (Pause 5s) When you are having a hard day, when you miss someone or something deeply, or when you simply need comfort, you can return to this feeling.

You can remember the gentle garden. (Pause 5s) You deserve to be met with compassionfrom others and from yourself. You deserve the comfort that comes from allowing your grief. (Pause 3s)

The garden has opened something in you. A place of safety. A place of acceptance.

You can cope. You are coping. Believe it. (Pause 5s)

And whenever the world tells you to move on before you are ready, you can return to the garden. You know your own pace. You know that healing cannot be rushed. (Pause 3s)

So take this gift with you. The gift of the gentle garden. The gift of self-compassion in grief. (Pause 5s)

Your mind and body have learned something today. They will remember. When you need a safe place, you will have the garden.

When you need permission to feel, you will have it. (Pause 3s) You are building a relationship with your loss that is kind. One gentle moment at a time.

The garden is within you. You can return whenever you need. You are allowed to grieve.

You are allowed to heal. (Pause 3s) From this day forward, let the garden hold you. When grief is heavy, picture the soft light.

When you feel alone, remember that you have this safe place. (Pause 5s) You have given yourself permission to heal at your own pace. That permission will stay with you. (Pause 3s)

Honour your grief. Honour your love. You deserve to be gentle with yourself.

The garden is yours for life. (Pause 3s) And as we bring you back to full awareness, hold on to that feeling. You are supported.

You can cope. You do not have to get over your loss quickly. (Pause 5s) Your subconscious will remind you.

Whenever grief feels too heavy, you can return to the garden. To the soft light. To the comfort of acceptance. (Pause 3s)

You are allowed to grieve. You are allowed to carry love forward. You have a safe place.

Trust that. (Pause 3s) The garden is part of you now. It will be there whenever you close your eyes and seek comfort. (Pause 5s)

You have taken an important step. You have connected with a place of comfort for your grief. Let it hold you.

Let it support your healing. You deserve this gentleness. The gentle garden of memory is always with you. (Pause 3s)

So go forward into your day with this knowledge. With this comfort. With the permission to heal at your own pace. (Pause 5s)

Your mind has received this training. It will support you. You are allowed to grieve.

You are allowed to heal. Believe it. (Pause 3s) You have the garden.

You have permission to take your time. Use them well. You are supported.

You are allowed to carry love forward. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious holds the image of the gentle garden. It will remind you to be kind to yourself.

You can cope with grief. You can heal. You have this now.

The garden is yours. Gentleness is your right. From this day forward.

You are supported. Go in peace."

## Termination

"Now, it is time to gently return to your full waking awareness, bringing with you all the comfort, safety, and permission to heal at your own pace. (Pause 3s) I will count from one to five, and with each number, you will feel more and more alert, refreshed, and ready to engage with your day.

One... beginning to feel a gentle energy returning to your body. You are safe and grounded. Two... becoming more aware of your surroundings, feeling grounded and present in the room.

Three... feeling refreshed and comforted, carrying the gentle garden of memory with you into your day. Four... your mind is clear, your body is energised, and you are ready to open your eyes. And five... eyes open, wide awake, feeling absolutely wonderful, comforted, and ready to embrace your day with gentleness and self-compassion. (Pause 3s)

Remember: the gentle garden of memory is within you. You can heal at your own pace. You can carry love forward."

## Induction - Progressive Relaxation

"As you settle into a comfortable position, allow your eyes to gently close. (Pause 3s) Take a deep, calming breath in through your nose... and as you exhale slowly through your mouth, release any tension you might be holding in your shoulders or your jaw. (Pause 3s) Continue to breathe deeply and evenly, allowing each breath to carry you deeper into relaxation.

With every out-breath, you let go a little more. With every in-breath, you invite calm and stillness. (Pause 5s)

Bring your awareness to your feet. Notice the weight of your feet resting on the floor or the surface beneath you. Feel your toes relaxing... each toe letting go of any tension.

Feel the soles of your feet becoming soft and heavy. Feel your heels sinking... your ankles releasing. (Pause 3s) Let this wave of relaxation move slowly up through your calves, your shins, and your knees.

Your legs feel heavy and relaxed, as if they are gently melting into the support beneath you. (Pause 5s)

Feel your thighs relaxing, becoming soft and loose. This soothing sensation continues into your hips and your lower back, releasing any stiffness or holding. Your abdomen softens... your stomach muscles letting go completely.

Your chest relaxes with each gentle breath. (Pause 3s) Feel the relaxation spreading up your spine, vertebra by vertebra... through your shoulders, and down your arms to your elbows, your forearms, your wrists, and your fingertips. Your arms are loose and heavy. (Pause 5s)

Your neck relaxes... your jaw unclenches... your tongue rests gently in your mouth... your facial muscles soften... your forehead is smooth and calm. Your eyelids feel wonderfully heavy. (Pause 3s) You are now deeply relaxed, peaceful, and calm.

Your whole body feels supported. Your mind is becoming still. (Pause 5s) Every time you breathe out, you go a little deeper.

Deeper and deeper into this safe, comfortable state of relaxation. Nothing can disturb you here. You are safe.

You are at ease. (Pause 5s)"

## Deepener - The Joy Garden

"Imagine yourself stepping into a beautiful garden filled with light and colour. (Pause 3s) The sun is warm on your skin. Flowers bloom in every hue.

The air is sweet and fresh. (Pause 3s) This is the joy gardena place where positive emotions grow naturally. You are not here to force happiness.

You are here to notice it. To appreciate it. (Pause 5s) In the centre of the garden, you notice a soft, golden lightan inner sunthat seems to glow from within you.

It is your capacity for joy. It has always been there. (Pause 5s) You walk slowly through the garden.

You notice small delights: the scent of a flower, the song of a bird, the feeling of grass beneath your feet. (Pause 3s) With each step, you feel a little lighter. A little more open to happiness.

The joy garden is within you now. You can return whenever you wish to cultivate joy. (Pause 5s)"

## Therapeutic Content

"Now, in this relaxed and open state, feel a deep sense of joy awakening within you. (Pause 3s) You recognise that joy is not something that only happens to other people. It is available to you.

You can seek it. You can appreciate it. You can allow it. (Pause 5s)

Any old habits of overlooking the good, focusing only on problems, or dismissing small pleasures simply soften and fade. In their place, gratitude and optimism grow. (Pause 5s) Imagine yourself in an ordinary momentperhaps a morning coffee, a walk, a conversation with a friend.

See yourself pausing to notice what is good. To feel the warmth of that moment. (Pause 3s) You do not need a reason to feel joy.

Joy can be a choice. A practice. A way of paying attention to the positive. (Pause 5s)

From this moment forward, you will find it easier to cultivate joy in all areas of your life. You will instinctively notice beauty. You will appreciate small pleasures.

You will carry an attitude of gratitude. (Pause 5s) Your daily happiness will increase. Not because everything is perfect, but because you are training your mind to see and savour what is good. (Pause 3s)

When you feel the old habit of focusing only on what is wrong, you can picture the joy garden. You can remember the inner sun. You can ask: what is one good thing in this moment? (Pause 5s)

You are becoming a person who seeks and appreciates joy. A source of positive emotion in your own life. (Pause 3s) See yourself tomorrow... waking up and taking a moment to notice something you are grateful for.

A simple pleasure. A small delight. (Pause 5s) See yourself next week... in a situation that might once have passed unnoticed.

This time, you pause. You appreciate. You feel a flicker of joy. (Pause 5s)

See yourself in the months to come... your days brighter because you are actively cultivating joy. You notice the good. You savour it.

You carry optimism with you. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious has received these suggestions. It will remind you of the joy garden.

It will help you choose appreciation when the old habit of overlooking joy tries to return. (Pause 5s) Joy is not frivolous. It is nourishing.

It improves your health. It strengthens your relationships. It makes life feel worth living. (Pause 5s)

So let this feeling of joy sink in. You deserve to feel happy. You deserve to notice and appreciate the good in your life. (Pause 3s)

The joy garden is within you. Whenever you need to remember, you can close your eyes and see the flowers. Feel the inner sun. (Pause 5s)

You deserve daily happiness. You deserve to experience positive emotions without guilt or dismissal. (Pause 3s) From this day forward, joy is something you can cultivate.

You are building a life of appreciation and optimism. One moment at a time. (Pause 5s) In the morning, you can take a moment to name one thing you are grateful for.

Before sleep, you can recall one good thing that happened. (Pause 5s) At work, you can notice small wins. A task completed.

A kind word. A moment of progress. (Pause 3s) With family and friends, you can savour their presence.

You can express appreciation. You can share joy. (Pause 5s) When life is difficult, you can still allow space for joy.

Joy and difficulty can coexist. A moment of laughter does not deny the struggle. It simply honours the full range of life. (Pause 5s)

Your subconscious is now aligned with joy. It will remind you of the garden. It will help you seek and appreciate the positive. (Pause 3s)

Let that truth settle in. You are a person who can feel joy. You are learning to cultivate it.

You have this resource now. Use it well. (Pause 3s) The joy garden is yours.

The inner sun is yours. The capacity for daily happiness is yours. (Pause 3s) When you see something beautiful, you can pause to take it in.

When someone is kind, you can feel the warmth. When you accomplish something, you can celebrateeven in a small way. (Pause 5s) Joy is a gift you give yourself.

It does not depend on perfection. It depends on attention. On gratitude.

On the choice to notice the good. (Pause 5s) You may have been told that joy is for other people. Now you know it is for you too. (Pause 3s)

Every time you choose to notice and appreciate something good, you strengthen this new habit. Your subconscious is learning: I can feel joy. I can cultivate happiness. (Pause 5s)

The world will still have challenges. Your job is not to ignore them. Your job is to balance them with appreciation.

To allow positive emotions their place. (Pause 3s) Each time you succeed, you prove to yourself that joy is possible. That you can do this.

That the joy garden is real. (Pause 5s) So hold on to this feeling as we prepare to bring you back. You have connected with the joy garden.

You have connected with your capacity for joy. (Pause 5s) Your mind and body will remember. When you forget to notice the good, you can return to the garden.

To the inner sun. To the question: what can I appreciate right now? (Pause 3s) You deserve to feel joy.

You deserve daily happiness. The joy garden is yours. Use it.

Trust it. You are a person who cultivates joy now. (Pause 3s) Whenever you listen to this script again, the connection to the joy garden will deepen.

Your capacity for joy will grow. (Pause 5s) You are not becoming someone else. You are allowing a part of yourself that has always had the capacity for joy to take the lead. (Pause 3s)

Positive emotions are not a luxury. They are a resource. They help you cope.

They help you connect. They help you thrive. (Pause 5s) The garden is yours.

The inner sun is yours. The feeling of appreciation and optimism is yours. (Pause 3s) So as you go back into your day, carry the joy garden with you.

When you feel the first flicker of negativity taking over, pause. Breathe. Remember the flowers.

The light. (Pause 5s) You have everything you need to cultivate joy. You have this experience.

You have the image of the garden. You have the choice, from now on, to seek and appreciate the good. (Pause 3s) Let that truth guide you.

You can feel joy. You can cultivate happiness. You can live with gratitude and optimism. (Pause 3s)

Your subconscious has received these suggestions. It will support your joy in the days and weeks to come. (Pause 5s) When you are having a hard day, when you feel flat, or when you simply want to feel better, you can return to this feeling.

You can remember the joy garden. (Pause 5s) You deserve to experience positive emotions. You deserve the daily happiness that comes from appreciation. (Pause 3s)

The joy garden has opened something in you. That opening is permanent. You are a person who can cultivate joy.

Believe it. Live it. (Pause 5s) And whenever the world tempts you to focus only on the negative, you can smile inwardly.

You know another way. You know the way of the joy garden. You choose appreciation.

Again and again. You choose joy. (Pause 3s) So take this gift with you.

The gift of the joy garden. The gift of cultivating joy. (Pause 5s) Your mind and body have learned something today.

They will remember. When you need to feel better, you will know how. When you need to notice the good, you will have the garden. (Pause 3s)

You are building a life of appreciation and daily happiness. One joyful moment at a time. The garden is within you.

The inner sun is always there. You can feel joy. You can cultivate it.

You are free to choose appreciation. (Pause 3s) From this day forward, let the joy garden guide you. When you feel low, picture the flowers.

When you feel flat, remember the inner sun. (Pause 5s) You have trained your mind for joy. That training will stay with you. (Pause 3s)

Honour this change. Use it. You deserve to live with more positive emotion.

The joy garden is yours for life. (Pause 3s) And as we bring you back to full awareness, hold on to that feeling. You are open to joy.

You can appreciate. You do not have to wait for perfect circumstances to be happy. (Pause 5s) Your subconscious will remind you.

Whenever you forget to notice the good, you can return to the garden. To the inner sun. To the practice of appreciation. (Pause 3s)

You are a person who cultivates joy. You have connected with that truth today. Trust that.

Live that. The garden is there. You can visit it anytime.

You choose joy. (Pause 3s) The joy garden is part of you now. It will be there whenever you close your eyes and seek happiness. (Pause 5s)

You have taken an important step. You have connected with your capacity for joy. Let it guide you.

Let it brighten your days. You deserve this happiness. You have the capacity for it.

The joy garden is always with you. (Pause 3s) So go forward into your day with this openness. With this appreciation.

With the knowledge that you can cultivate joy. (Pause 5s) Your mind has received this training. It will support you.

You are ready. You are open to joy. Believe it. (Pause 3s)

You have the joy garden. You have the inner sun. Use them well.

You are capable of happiness. You can appreciate the good. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious holds the image of the joy garden.

It will remind you to notice and savour. You are a person who cultivates joy. Trust yourself.

You have this now. The garden is yours. Joy is your practice.

From this day forward. You are ready. You are open to happiness. (Pause 3s)

Seeking joy does not mean ignoring difficulty. It means balancing your attention so that positive emotions have a place in your life. Gratitude and optimism are choices that become easier with practice.

The inner sun is always available to warm you. (Pause 5s) Daily happiness is built from small moments of appreciation. You can notice the taste of your food, the comfort of your bed, the smile of a stranger.

Each notice is a step into the joy garden. (Pause 3s) Go in peace."

## Termination

"Now, it is time to gently return to your full waking awareness, bringing with you all the positive feelings of joy, gratitude, and optimism. (Pause 3s) I will count from one to five, and with each number, you will feel more and more alert, refreshed, and ready to engage with your day.

One... beginning to feel a gentle energy returning to your body. You are safe and grounded. Two... becoming more aware of your surroundings, feeling grounded and present in the room.

Three... feeling refreshed and uplifted, carrying your capacity for joy with you into your day. Four... your mind is clear, your body is energised, and you are ready to open your eyes. And five... eyes open, wide awake, feeling absolutely wonderful, joyful, and ready to embrace your day with appreciation and happiness. (Pause 3s)

Remember: the joy garden is within you. You can cultivate joy and daily happiness."

scripts.title: Overcoming Shyness
scripts.introduction: This script is designed to help individuals overcome shyness, fostering greater social confidence, ease in interactions, and a natural ability to express themselves. It aims to reprogram feelings of self-consciousness into genuine connection.
scripts.content:
## Induction - Progressive Relaxation

"As you settle into a comfortable position, allow your eyes to gently close. (Pause 3s) Take a deep, calming breath in through your nose... and as you exhale slowly through your mouth, release any tension you might be holding in your shoulders or your jaw. Deeper and deeper into this safe, comfortable state of relaxation. Nothing can disturb you here. You are safe.

You are at ease. (Pause 5s)"

## Deepener - The Open Door

"Imagine yourself standing in a comfortable room. Across from you is a door. It is open.

Warm light streams through it. (Pause 3s) You are not being pushed. You are simply being invited.

This is the door to the confident selfthe part of you that can step into social ease. (Pause 3s) You walk slowly towards the door. With each step, you feel a little lighter.

The self-consciousness that sometimes holds you back begins to soften. (Pause 5s) You step through the door. On the other side, you find not a stage, not a performancebut connection.

Ease. The freedom to be yourself. (Pause 5s) You are not here to become someone else.

You are here to allow the confident self that has always been within you to come forward. (Pause 3s) The open door is within you now. You can step through it whenever you wish to connect with others without shyness holding you back. (Pause 5s)"

## Therapeutic Content

"Now, in this relaxed and safe state, feel a deep sense of social confidence awakening within you. (Pause 3s) You recognise that shyness is not a fixed part of who you are. It is a pattern that can soften.

That can fade. You have the right to express yourself. To connect.

To be seen. (Pause 5s) Any old habits of holding back, avoiding social situations, or believing that you must perform perfectly simply dissolve and fade. In their place, ease and self-assurance grow. (Pause 5s)

Imagine yourself in a situation that once would have made you shyperhaps a gathering, a meeting, or a conversation with someone new. (Pause 3s) See yourself stepping through the open door. Not performing.

Not trying to be impressive. Simply being present. Connecting. (Pause 5s)

You understand that connection is not about performance. It is about presence. About listening.

About allowing yourself to be seen without the need to be perfect. (Pause 5s) From this moment forward, you will find it easier to overcome shyness in all areas of your life. You will instinctively step into social situations with more ease.

You will express yourself more freely. (Pause 3s) Your self-consciousness will fade. Not because you become someone else, but because you allow the confident self that has always been there to take the lead. (Pause 5s)

When you feel the old urge to shrink back or stay silent, you can picture the open door. You can breathe. You can remember: I am here to connect, not to perform. (Pause 5s)

You are becoming a person who can step into social ease. A person who can express themselves. Who can connect. (Pause 3s)

See yourself tomorrow... in a situation that would once have made you shy. This time, you step through the door. You show up.

You allow yourself to be present. (Pause 5s) See yourself next week... starting a conversation. Not because you have to be the life of the party, but because you want to connect.

You speak. You listen. You are at ease. (Pause 5s)

See yourself in the months to come... your social confidence growing. You attend gatherings without dread. You share your thoughts.

You allow others to see you. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious has received these suggestions. It will remind you of the open door.

It will help you choose connection when the old habit of shyness tries to return. (Pause 5s) Shyness is not a character flaw. It is a pattern that can change.

You can learn to feel at ease. You can learn to express yourself. (Pause 5s) So let this feeling of confidence sink in.

You deserve to connect. You deserve to be seen. You deserve to express yourself without constant self-consciousness. (Pause 3s)

The open door is within you. Whenever you need to remember, you can close your eyes and see yourself stepping through it. (Pause 5s) You deserve to feel at ease in social situations.

You deserve the freedom to be yourself with others. (Pause 3s) From this day forward, social confidence is something you can cultivate. You are building a life of connection, not performance.

One step at a time. (Pause 5s) In conversations, you will find yourself speaking when you have something to say. Not dominating.

Not performing. Simply participating. (Pause 5s) At work, you will contribute your ideas.

You will ask questions. You will show up in meetings without the old weight of self-consciousness. (Pause 3s) With new people, you will introduce yourself.

You will make eye contact. You will allow the conversation to flow without overthinking every word. (Pause 5s) When you feel the familiar pull of shyness, you can pause.

You can breathe. You can remember: the goal is connection, not perfection. (Pause 5s) Your subconscious is now aligned with social confidence.

It will remind you of the open door. It will help you step forward when the old habit of holding back tries to return. (Pause 3s) Let that truth settle in.

You are a person who can connect. You are learning to express yourself. You have this resource now.

Use it well. (Pause 3s) The open door is yours. The confident self is yours.

The ability to step into social ease is yours. (Pause 3s) When you enter a room, you do not have to be the centre of attention. You only have to be present.

When you speak, you do not have to be brilliant. You only have to be genuine. (Pause 5s) Connection is a gift you give yourself as much as others.

It reduces loneliness. It opens opportunities. It allows you to be fully yourself. (Pause 5s)

You may have believed that you are simply shy. Now you know that you can grow. That self-consciousness can fade. (Pause 3s)

Every time you choose to step through the doorto show up, to speak, to connectyou strengthen this new habit. Your subconscious is learning: I can do this. I can be at ease. (Pause 5s)

The world will still have situations that feel challenging. Your job is not to become an extrovert. Your job is to allow yourself to connect without being held back by shyness. (Pause 3s)

Each time you succeed, you prove to yourself that social confidence is possible. That you can do this. That the open door is real. (Pause 5s)

So hold on to this feeling as we prepare to bring you back. You have connected with the open door. You have connected with your confident self. (Pause 5s)

Your mind and body will remember. When shyness rises, you can answer with a breath. With the image of the door.

With the knowledge that you can step through. (Pause 3s) You deserve to feel at ease. You deserve to express yourself.

The open door is yours. Use it. Trust it.

You are overcoming shyness now. (Pause 3s) Whenever you listen to this script again, the connection to the confident self will deepen. Your social ease will grow. (Pause 5s)

You are not becoming someone else. You are allowing a part of yourself that has always had the capacity for connection to take the lead. (Pause 3s) Expressing yourself is not selfish.

It is how you connect. It is how you contribute. It is how you let others know who you are. (Pause 5s)

The door is yours. The confident self is yours. The feeling of social ease is yours. (Pause 3s)

So as you go back into your day, carry the open door with you. When you feel the first flicker of shyness, pause. Breathe.

Remember that you can step through. (Pause 5s) You have everything you need to overcome shyness. You have this experience.

You have the image of the door. You have the choice, from now on, to connect rather than hide. (Pause 3s) Let that truth guide you.

You can be at ease. You can express yourself. You can connect without performance. (Pause 3s)

Your subconscious has received these suggestions. It will support your social confidence in the days and weeks to come. (Pause 5s) When you are about to enter a social situation, when you want to speak but feel the old pull to stay silent, or when you simply want to feel more at ease, you can return to this feeling.

You can remember the open door. (Pause 5s) You deserve to be seen. You deserve to connect.

You deserve the freedom that comes from expressing yourself. (Pause 3s) The open door has opened something in you. That opening is permanent.

You are a person who can overcome shyness. Believe it. Live it. (Pause 5s)

And whenever the old self-consciousness tries to return, you can picture the door. You know another way. You know the way of the confident self.

You choose connection. Again and again. You choose to step through. (Pause 3s)

So take this gift with you. The gift of the open door. The gift of social confidence. (Pause 5s)

Your mind and body have learned something today. They will remember. When you need to connect, you will know how.

When you need to express yourself, you will have the door. (Pause 3s) You are building a life of connection and ease. One step through the door at a time.

The confident self is within you. You can access it whenever you choose. You are at ease.

You can connect. You are free to express yourself. (Pause 3s) From this day forward, let the open door guide you.

When you feel shy, picture the door. When you want to hold back, take a breath and step through. (Pause 5s) You have trained your mind for social ease.

That training will stay with you. (Pause 3s) Honour this change. Use it.

You deserve to live without shyness holding you back. The open door is yours for life. (Pause 3s) And as we bring you back to full awareness, hold on to that feeling.

You are confident. You can connect. You do not have to perform to be worthy of connection. (Pause 5s)

Your subconscious will remind you. Whenever shyness rises, you can return to the door. To the confident self.

To the ease of connection. (Pause 3s) You are overcoming shyness. You have connected with that truth today.

Trust that. Live that. The door is there.

You can step through. You choose connection. (Pause 3s) The open door is part of you now.

It will be there whenever you close your eyes and seek social ease. (Pause 5s) You have taken an important step. You have connected with your confident self.

Let it guide you. Let it ease your social experiences. You deserve this freedom.

You have the capacity for it. The open door is always with you. (Pause 3s) So go forward into your day with this confidence.

With this ease. With the knowledge that you can express yourself and connect. (Pause 5s) Your mind has received this training.

It will support you. You are ready. You are capable of social ease.

Believe it. (Pause 3s) You have the open door. You have the confident self.

Use them well. You are at ease. You can connect.

Self-consciousness is fading. (Pause 3s) Your subconscious holds the image of the open door. It will remind you to step forward.

You are overcoming shyness. Trust yourself. You have this now.

The door is yours. Connection is your choice. From this day forward.

You are ready. You are at ease. (Pause 3s) Social confidence grows each time you choose to show up rather than hide.

The confident self is not a performance; it is the freedom to be present and to express yourself without constant self-consciousness. (Pause 5s) Go in peace."

## Termination

"Now, it is time to gently return to your full waking awareness, bringing with you all the positive feelings of social confidence, ease, and the freedom to express yourself. (Pause 3s) I will count from one to five, and with each number, you will feel more and more alert, refreshed, and ready to engage with your day.

One... beginning to feel a gentle energy returning to your body. You are safe and grounded. Two... becoming more aware of your surroundings, feeling grounded and present in the room.

Three... feeling refreshed and confident, carrying your social ease with you into your day. Four... your mind is clear, your body is energised, and you are ready to open your eyes. And five... eyes open, wide awake, feeling absolutely wonderful, confident, and ready to embrace your day with ease and connection. (Pause 3s)

Remember: the open door is within you. You can step into social ease and express yourself."

scripts.title: Releasing Guilt and Shame
scripts.introduction: This script is designed to help individuals release the burdens of guilt and shame, fostering self-forgiveness, acceptance, and emotional freedom. It aims to reprogram self-condemnation into self-compassion and healing.
scripts.content:
## Induction - Progressive Relaxation

"As you settle into a comfortable position, allow your eyes to gently close.
